citations.narrative:
There was one enclosure housing 13 guinea pigs that contained a rusty metal self-feeder. The rust had caused the corner
of the bottom lip of the feeder to break resulting in a sharp edge.
Sharp edges on feeders in enclosures can cause injury to the guinea pigs as they are feeding.
Primary enclosures must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the guinea pigs from injury.
Correct by: March 24, 2025

There were several housekeeping issues in the guinea pig facility. There was an accumulation of fecal material, dust,
discarded food, and wet brown sludge on the windowsills. The licensee said they clean them a couple times a year. There
were spiderwebs on the ceiling, around the windowsills, and around the pipes for the watering system. There was an
accumulation of items including old feeders, a paint can, a notebook, and other dirt and debris on the floor next to the first
enclosure in the 2nd row from the left.
The lack of sanitation and presence of dust and debris may attract pests into the room, result in unpleasant odors, and
may contribute to spread of disease.
The buildings used for housing animals must be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
facilitate prescribed husbandry practices and maintain the health of the animals.
Correct by: April 7, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.28(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There was one enclosure housing 13 guinea pigs that contained a rusty metal self-feeder. The rust had caused the corner 
of the bottom lip of the feeder to break resulting in a sharp edge. 
Sharp edges on feeders in enclosures can cause injury to the guinea pigs as they are feeding. 
Primary enclosures must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the guinea pigs from injury. 
Correct by: March 24, 2025 
3.31(b) 
   
Sanitation. 
There were several housekeeping issues in the guinea pig facility. There was an accumulation of fecal material, dust, 
discarded food, and wet brown sludge on the windowsills. The licensee said they clean them a couple times a year. There 
were spiderwebs on the ceiling, around the windowsills, and around the pipes for the watering system. There was an 
accumulation of items including old feeders, a paint can, a notebook, and other dirt and debris on the floor next to the first 
enclosure in the 2nd row from the left. 
The lack of sanitation and presence of dust and debris may attract pests into the room, result in unpleasant odors, and 
may contribute to spread of disease.  
The buildings used for housing animals must be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
facilitate prescribed husbandry practices and maintain the health of the animals. 
Correct by: April 7, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
